TaxonIdentification.subspecies_authority: J. E. Keeley, L. Boykin & Massihi

treatment.description: Plants, erect, 1–2 m; burl present. Leaf blades gray-glaucous, dull. 2n = 26, 52.
treatment.discussion: Subspecies desertica is found in the Santa Rosa Mountains and inner Peninsular Range of Riverside and San Diego counties.
